post_text:
FREE MEALS / COMIDAS GRATIS

We are pleased to let you know that meals are free for all children 18 and under, from any school in the area.

You may pick up your free meals every day Monday thru Friday between the hours of 7:30 am and 8:30 am at Bidwell, Jackson Heights, Metteer, or Vista.
*****
Nos complace informarle que las comidas son gratuitas para todos los niños menores de 18 años de cualquier escuela de la zona.

Puede recoger sus comidas gratis todos los días de lunes a viernes entre las 7:30 am y las 8:30 am en Bidwell, Jackson Heights, Metteer o Vista.

post_text:
Education for:
Every Student Every Day
That is the unified goal of districts across Tehama County.
The superintendents are working closely together, sharing research and best practices. And they are receiving guidance from county health department leaders.

We are concerned about your students health and their education.
shared_text:
Tehama County Department Of Education is sharing a COVID-19 Update.
July 27 at 9:40 AM ·

What will the new school year look like? What can the community do to help?

With the first day of school right around the corner, your Tehama County School Superindents bring you an update on school reopening and how we can help ensure students return to the classroom. "Every Student, Every Day".

Wash your Hands
Stay in Place
Maintain Your Space
Cover Your Face

#EveryStudentEveryDay

post_text:
SUMMER MEALS!
¡COMIDAS DE VERANO!

The daily drive-up meals have been crucial for a great many families in our community.

We wanted you to know that they will continue for most of the summer.

From tomorrow June 8th through July 24th meals will continue to be served in Drive-thru fashion at Vista Preparatory Academy from 10 am to noon. Except Friday July 3 when the kitchen will be closed for the holiday.

Remember that all children under 18 are eligible for these free meals.

Thank you!
___________________

Las comidas diarias preparadas han sido cruciales para muchas familias en nuestra comunidad.

Queríamos que supieras que continuarán durante la mayor parte del verano.

Desde mañana, 8 de junio hasta el 24 de julio, las comidas se seguirán sirviendo de manera Drive-thru en Vista Preparatory Academy de 10 am a mediodía, de lunes a viernes. Excepto el viernes 3 de julio cuando la cocina estará cerrada por vacaciones.

Recuerde que todos los niños menores de 18 años son elegibles para estas comidas gratis.

¡Gracias!

post_text:
DISTANCE LEARNING STARTS MONDAY
[Español abajo]

Hello, this is a message from RBUESD. We want all families to be aware that the distance learning instruction begins Monday, April 27th and will continue through June 4th. Students and parents are expected to communicate with teachers about distance learning as they begin this process. A letter with more information is available online at our school and district websites.

Thank you.

English: https://bit.ly/2Yajbgt
Español: https://bit.ly/3bF1cme

Hola, este es un mensaje del Distrito Escolar Primario Red Bluff Union. Queremos que todas las familias sepan que la instrucción de aprendizaje a distancia comienza el lunes 27 de abril y continuará hasta el 4 de junio. Se espera que los estudiantes y los padres se comuniquen con los maestros sobre el aprendizaje a distancia al comenzar este proceso. Una carta con más información está disponible en línea en los sitios web de nuestras escuelas y distritos.

Gracias

post_text:
MEALS

We will continue serving hot lunches all through this Spring Break week. You can walk up or drive through at the Vista Preparatory Academy from 10 am until 12 pm.

Meals are free for all children, 18 and younger, regardless of what school they may attend.

We enjoy seeing your smiling faces, and we hope you remain safe and healthy!

Thank you.

Continuaremos sirviendo almuerzos calientes durante esta semana de vacaciones de primavera. Puede caminar o conducir en la Academia Preparatoria Vista de 10 a.m. a 12 p.m.

Las comidas son gratuitas para todos los niños, de 18 años y menores, independientemente de la escuela a la que asistan.

¡Disfrutamos ver tus caras sonrientes y esperamos que te mantengas sano y salvo!

Gracias.

post_text:
[Español abajo]
Good Morning Red Bluff Elementary Families,

It is our sincere hope that you and your students are doing well in these unprecedented circumstances.

We’d like to remind you that meals will be provided at Vista School from 10:00 to 12:00 Monday through Friday.

If you were unable to get an optional educational packet for your student, you may pick one up at our District Office today from 10:00 to 12:00 at 1755 Airport Blvd.
Also, another message will go out later today with information about a technology survey.

Thank You.
-----------------------------------

Buenos días familias de Red Bluff Elementary,

Esperamos sinceramente que usted y sus alumnos estén bien en estas circunstancias sin precedentes.

Le recordamos que las comidas se proporcionarán en Vista School de 10:00 a 12:00 de lunes a viernes.

Si no pudo obtener un paquete educativo opcional para su estudiante, puede recoger uno en nuestra Oficina del Distrito hoy de 10:00 a 12:00 en 1755 Airport Blvd.
Además, otro mensaje saldrá más tarde hoy con información sobre una encuesta tecnológica.

Gracias.

post_text:
CAMP HOPE
Informational meeting
Thursday March 19th, 5:30 - 6:60 at the Tehama County Department of Education.

Camp HOPE America is the first camping and mentoring initiative in the United States that focuses on children exposed to trauma. Please join us and learn how to become a camper, mentor, counselor or how to refer a child to the program. If you are interested in financially supporting Camp HOPE, this is the perfect opportunity to find out more information.
text:
CAMP HOPE
Informational meeting
Thursday March 19th, 5:30 - 6:60 at the Tehama County Department of Education.

Camp HOPE America is the first camping and mentoring initiative in the United States that focuses on children exposed to trauma. Please join us and learn how to become a camper, mentor, counselor or how to refer a child to the program. If you are interested in financially supporting Camp HOPE, this is the perfect opportunity to find out more information.

Our administration will remain in vigilant contact with local, state, and federal agencies.

post_text:
Dear Red Bluff Elementary Families and Staff,

None of our school sites have received notifications of potential power outages. As of now there will be school tomorrow at Bidwell, Jackson Heights, Metteer, and Vista. Please make plans to have your students attend school tomorrow, Wednesday the 20th.

Thank you.

Estimadas familias y personal de Red Bluff Elementary,

Ninguno de nuestros sitios escolares ha recibido notificaciones de posibles cortes de energía. A partir de ahora habrá escuela mañana en Bidwell, Jackson Heights, Metteer y Vista. Por favor haga planes para que sus estudiantes asistan a la escuela mañana miércoles 20.

Gracias.

https://krcrtv.com/news/tehama-county/church-in-red-bluff-makes-400-lunches-for-kids-out-of-school-because-of-pges-shutoffs

KRCRTV.COM
Church in Red Bluff makes 400 lunches for kids out of school because of PG&E's shutoffs

post_text:
BOND PUBLIC FORUM
Members of the community, members of the staff, and parents were in attendance to hear details about the District's bond and the factors involved in its utilization.

What can it be spent on?
What can't it be spent on?
What types of building options are available?
What are some opportunities that could maximize funds for our schools?
What are some pitfalls to be avoided?

All these topics were covered.
Many direct and relevant questions were asked of the Bond Committee members. Many direct answers were given. Other things are still unknown.

Thank you to everyone who participated.

Thank you to everyone who participated.

post_text:
PG&E has informed the district that some or all district schools will be without power Monday morning. As a result all district sites will be closed Monday. If the status of the power outage changes, we will send out messages with new information. Again, as of this time there will be no school at Bidwell, Jackson Heights, Metteer, and Vista on Monday.

PG&E ha informado al distrito que algunas o todas las escuelas del distrito estarán sin electricidad el lunes por la mañana. Como resultado, todos los sitios del distrito estarán cerrados el lunes. Si el estado del corte de energía cambia, enviaremos mensajes con nueva información. De nuevo, a partir de este momento no habrá escuela en Bidwell, Jackson Heights, Metteer y Vista el lunes.

post_text:
The situation with potential power outages is being monitored closely. It is still unclear how much of the school district is likely to be without power. We will be sending a message midday tomorrow when more information is available. As normal it will be sent via telephone, text, email, website, and social media. Your students' safety and learning is our highest priority. Your patience and understanding during this period of uncertainty is greatly appreciated. Thank you.

La situación con posibles cortes de energía está siendo monitoreada de cerca. Todavía no está claro qué parte del distrito escolar es probable que se quede sin electricidad. Mañana enviaremos un mensaje al mediodía cuando haya más información disponible. Normalmente, se enviará por teléfono, mensaje de texto, correo electrónico, sitio web y redes sociales. La seguridad y el aprendizaje de sus estudiantes es nuestra máxima prioridad. Su paciencia y comprensión durante este período de incertidumbre es muy apreciada. Gracias.

PG&E may have precautionary power outages tomorrow, Wednesday October 9th.

We are monitoring this situation along with the High School who provides our busing. We likely won't know PG&E's decision until very early tomorrow morning. If school is cancelled tomorrow, we will send a message to families as early as possible. Thank you.

The school district still has some seasoned oak firewood for sale. It is on pallets. It's in rounds, blocks, and smaller limbs.
$60 - $80 as marked.
Proceeds go back to all four schools.

Please call 530-527-7200 x110, M-F 7:30am-4:30pm
(please don't reply via Facebook).
Thanks!

July 11, 2019 at 8:12 AM ·

Busy day at Summer Serrf!
The Sheriff's Dept was out teaching water and boating safety.
The "Drug-Free Community Coalition" was helping students be aware not only of what's legal and/or safe, but also how to avoid harming themselves accidentally.

Practical, real-world lessons for our young folks!

post_text:
Meals available for ALL students this summer.
This year's summer program is at Jackson Heights Elementary, but you do _not_ have to be enrolled in the program.

ANYONE 18-years-old or younger is welcome to come to Jackson Heights during the posted serving times and get breakfast and lunch. No pre-registration or documentation
required. All meals must be eaten on site.

Breakfast served: 8:00 - 8:30, Mon - Fri
Lunch served: 11:45 - 12:00, Mon - Fri
Last day: July 19

post_text: Today, Vista Preparatory Academy had a transient enter our campus at the track, then came to the buildings and when was told to leave by Assistant Principal Humphreys, became belligerent, verbally abusive and refused to exit our campus. post_text:
It has become tradition that in lieu of purchasing presents for one another, the District Office staff pools personal money and negotiates a large purchase of shoes to be given as gifts at each of the sites.

The random drawing reaches students in every age bracket, and their excitement is deeply touching.

shared_text:
Bidwell Elementary School
December 12, 2018 at 8:45 AM ·

A Bidwell family (and extended family from our District Office) found a way bring some cheer to some families displaced by the Camp Fire.

For her 10th birthday celebration a Bidwell student had a winter pool party at a hotel in Chico, where there happened to be families from Paradise staying. They noticed there were no Christmas decorations, so they decided to pitch in and help. A whole group of Red Bluff folks gathered decorations and painted decorative, motivational gift-rocks for the families.

https://www.facebook.com/BidwellBulldogs/photos/a.150328915615810/293654467949920/?type=1&theater

post_text:
The RBUESD Tech Dept belongs to a north American Google system admin collaborative.

Bryan has worked hard to implement some new configurations available in the back end of our Google system. The folks who organize the monthly teleconference invited Bryan to speak on the implementation of these features in our environment.

It's a gold star for our district to have a system admin able to instruct scores our peers in much larger districts around the country.

Well done, Bryan!

post_text: To serve all of our students, we must acquire the skills to help some of our most challenged students. Yesterday, while families were still enjoying another day of Spring Break, all our teachers, paraprofessionals, cafeteria staff, office staff, custodians and everyone else spent the day continuing the ACEs training to help understand our students who often need the most strategic attention . . . and empathy.
